title: ESA Signs Starlab Commercial Space Station Agreement With Airbus and Voyager Space
summary: The European Space Agency has inked a memorandum of understanding with Airbus and Voyager Space to explore the potential of a Starlab commercial space station as a successor to the ISS.

title: Spire launches constellation management platform
summary: Spire Global, a space-based data and services firm, has launched a web-based app designed to simplify satellite constellation operations for its customers.

title: Bulgaria Signs The Artemis Accords
summary: Bulgaria is the 32nd country to officially joined the U.S.-led Artemis Accords, marking its commitment to principles for cooperative space exploration.

title: European governments and companies seek changes to georeturn
summary: European government and industry officials say the policy of “georeturn,” which guarantees nations receive contracts in proportion to their investments, needs to be adjusted, particularly to make Europe’s launch industry more competitive.

title: Virgin Galactic To Suspend VSS Unity Suborbital Flights In 2024
summary: Virgin Galactic has revealed in its latest earning call its decision to decrease the frequency of flights for its current suborbital vehicle, VSS Unity, with plans to cease operations entirely by mid-2024.
